meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a speech sound produced by vibration of the uvula against the back of the tongue.
meanings.sent1: The uvular sound in the language was unique and fascinating.
meanings.sent2: Her uvular pronunciation added a distinct flair to her speech.
meanings.sent3: The uvular accent made everyone giggle during the play rehearsal.
meanings.sent4: His uvular voice resonated through the room, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The uvular quality of his singing made the song unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A speech sound produced by vibration of the uvula against the back of the tongue.
meanings.sent1: The singer's uvular was clear and precise during the performance.
meanings.sent2: In some languages, the uvular is a common phoneme.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke about the uvular had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The uvular in his speech echoed like a distant drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a uvular as an example in the phonetics class.
